intro: Myosotis uruguayensis, commonly known as the Uruguay forget-me-not, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Uruguay and Argentina. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its small, delicate blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, temperate environments and has a low-growing, herbaceous habit. Its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are clustered in loose inflorescences. Myosotis uruguayensis is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
